name: HEC
description: Humanities group with economics and civics focus. Suitable for students interested in social sciences, economics, policy-making, law, and government. Strong foundation for civil services, law, journalism, and policy analysis. Hybrid nature allows some commerce elements.

characteristics.target_students: Policy makers, civil servants, lawyers, economists, journalists, administrators
characteristics.aptitude: Analytical thinking, current affairs awareness, writing skills, ethics, public interest

progression.11th_12th: Studies history, economics, civics with depth in social understanding
progression.after_12th: Multiple pathways: (1) BA Humanities + UPSC/Law, (2) BA LLB direct, (3) Diploma in Journalism, (4) B.Com for business blend
progression.after_graduation: Professional exams (UPSC, CLAT, CA if commerce blend), Master's programs, direct employment

advantages: Clear path to prestigious civil services (IAS/IPS/IFS)
Strong foundation for law studies (judiciary, corporate law, NGO work)
Media and journalism careers with strong voice
Policy influence and social impact roles
Flexibility to add commerce skills for business policy
challenges: Highly competitive exams (UPSC has 0.001% selection rate)
Limited private sector focus compared to science/commerce
Requires strong current affairs and reading habits
market_demand: High for government jobs, medium for private sector (policy roles, consulting)
